intro: Knautia dipsacifolia f. angustata, commonly known as narrowleaf knautia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caprifoliaceae. It is characterized by its slender, angular stems and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, giving the plant its "angustata" designation. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower displays.
